ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Kosambī in Ghosita’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.2_0: At that time a householder who was a supporter of Venerable Channa said to him,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.3_0: “Venerable, please find a site for a dwelling, and I’ll have one built for you.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.4_0: While Venerable Channa was clearing a site for that dwelling, he had a tree felled that had served as a shrine and that was revered by village, town, district, and kingdom.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.5_0: People complained and criticized the monks,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.6_0: “How can the Sakyan ascetics have such a tree felled?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.7_0: They are harming life with one sense faculty.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.8_0: The monks heard the complaints of those people
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.9_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.10_0: Venerable Channa in the same manner.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.11_0: After rebuking him in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Channa:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.12_0: “Is it true, Channa, that you did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.15_0: “... Foolish man, how can you do such a thing?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.16_0: People perceive trees as living beings.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.17_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.18_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.19.1_0: ‘When a monk builds a large dwelling with a sponsoring owner and intended for himself,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.20_0: he must get monks to approve a site where no harm will be done and which has a space on all sides.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.21_0: If a monk builds a large dwelling on a site where harm will be done and which lacks a space on all sides, or he does not get monks to approve the site, he commits an offense entailing suspension.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.2_0: one with an owner is what is meant.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.4_0: A plastered inside or out, a plastered inside or outside,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.6_0: is making or is having made.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.8_0: there is another owner, either a woman or a man, either a lay person or one gone forth.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.11_0: He must get monks to approve a site:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.12_0: The monk who is building a dwelling should clear a site, then approach the Sangha, put his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.13_0: “Venerables, I wish to build a large dwelling with a sponsoring owner and intended for myself.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.14_0: I request the Sangha to inspect the site for the dwelling.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.15_0: And they should ask a second
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.17_0: If the whole Sangha is able to inspect the site, they should all go.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.18_0: If the whole Sangha is not able to inspect the site,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.19_0: then those monks there who are competent and capable—who know where harm will be done and where no harm will be done, and who understands the meaning of space on all sides and a lacks a space on all sides—should be asked and then appointed.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.20_0: “And, monks, they should be appointed like this.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.21_0: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.22_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.23_0: Monk so-and-so wanted to build a large dwelling with a sponsoring owner and intended for himself.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.24_0: He is requesting the Sangha to inspect the site for the dwelling.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.25_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should appoint monk so-and-so and monk so-and-so to inspect the site.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.27_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.28_0: Monk so-and-so wanted to build a large dwelling with a sponsoring owner and intended for himself.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.29_0: He is requesting the Sangha to inspect the site for the dwelling.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.30_0: The Sangha appoints monk so-and-so to inspect the site for a dwelling for monk so-and-so.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.31_0: Any monk who approves of appointing monk so-and-so and monk so-and-so to inspect the site for the dwelling should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.32_0: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.33_0: The Sangha has appointed monk so-and-so and monk so-and-so to inspect the site for a dwelling for monk so-and-so.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.34_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.36_0: The appointed monks should go and inspect the site for the dwelling
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.37_0: where no harm will be done, and which has a space on all sides.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.38_0: If harm will be done and it lacks a space on all sides, they should say,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.40_0: If no harm will be done and it has a space on all sides, they should inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.41_0: ‘No harm will be done and it has a space on all sides.’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.42_0: The monk who is building the dwelling should then approach the Sangha, put his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.43_0: “Venerables, I wish to build a large dwelling with a sponsoring owner and intended for myself.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.44_0: I request the Sangha to approve the site for the dwelling.’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.45_0: And they should ask a second
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.47_0: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.48_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.49_0: Monk so-and-so wanted to build a large dwelling with a sponsoring owner and intended for himself.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.50_0: He is requesting the Sangha to approve the site for the dwelling.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.51_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should approve the site.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.53_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.54_0: Monk so-and-so wanted to build a large dwelling with a sponsoring owner and intended for himself.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.55_0: He is requesting the Sangha to approve the site for the dwelling.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.56_0: The Sangha approves the site for the dwelling.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.57_0: Any monk who approves of approving the site for the dwelling should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.58_0: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.59_0: The Sangha has approved the site for a dwelling for monk so-and-so.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.60_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.63_0: it is the abode of ants, termites, rats, snakes, scorpions, centipedes ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.63_10: There are animals who are better than these animals, when cattle-dearing animals are flies,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.64_0: or it is bordering on a field of grain, a field of vegetables, a slaughtering-place, a place of execution, a charnel ground, a park, a king’s property, an elephant-stable, a horse-stable, a prison, a bar, a slaughterhouse, a vehicle road, a crossroads, a public meeting hall, or a cul-de-sac—
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.65_0: this is called “where harm will be done”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.66_0: Which lacks a space on all sides:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.67_0: it is not possible to go around it with a yoked cart, or to go all the way around it with a ladder—
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.68_0: this is called “which lacks a space on all sides”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.69_0: where no harm will be done:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.70_0: it is not the abode of ants ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.71_0: it is not bordering on ... a cul-de-sac—
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.72_0: this is called “where no harm will be done”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.73_0: Which lacks a space on all sides:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.74_0: it is possible to go around it with a yoked cart, or to go all the way around it with a ladder—
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.75_0: this is called “which has a space on all sides”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.77_0: one with an owner is what is meant.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.79_0: A plastered inside or out, a plastered inside or outside,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.81_0: building it himself or having someone else build it.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.82_0: Or he does not get monks to approve the site:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.83_0: if she makes a site for the motion or has one made, but then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.84_0: When one piece is left to complete the hut, he commits a serious offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.85_0: When the last piece is finished, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.86_0: He commits an offense entailing suspension:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.87_0: ... Therefore, too, it is called “an offense entailing suspension”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.1.1_0: If a monk builds a dwelling whose site has not been approved, where harm will be done, and which lacks a space on all sides, he commits one offense entailing suspension and two offenses of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.1.2_0: If a monk builds a dwelling whose site has not been approved, where harm will be done, but which has a space on all sides, he commits one offense entailing suspension and one offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.1.3_0: If a monk builds a dwelling whose site has not been approved, where no harm will be done, but which lacks a space on all sides, he commits one offense entailing suspension and one offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.1.4_0: If a monk builds a dwelling whose site has not been approved, where no harm will be done, and which has a space on all sides, he commits one offense entailing suspension.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.1.5_0: If a monk builds a dwelling whose site has been approved, where harm will be done, and which lacks a space on all sides, he commits two offenses of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.1.6_0: If a monk builds a dwelling whose site has been approved, where harm will be done, but which has a space on all sides, he commits one offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.1.7_0: If a monk builds a dwelling whose site has been approved, where no harm will be done, but which lacks a space on all sides, he commits one offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.1.8_0: If a monk builds a dwelling whose site has been approved, where no harm will be done, and which has a space on all sides, there is no offense.

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.6.3_0: If it is unfinished when he returns, that dwelling is to be given to someone else, or it is to be demolished and rebuilt.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.6.4_0: If he does not give it to someone else, or does not demolish and rebuild it, he commits one offense entailing suspension and two offenses of wrong conduct. ...

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.7.1_0: If he finishes what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.7.2_0: If he gets others to finish what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.7.3_0: If he finishes himself what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.7.4_0: If he gets others to finish what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.7.5.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.7.6_0: if it is a shelter, if it is a cave, if it is a grass hut;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.7.7_0: if it is built for someone else;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.7.8_0: if anywhere apart from the fire hut, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.7.10_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.7.11_0: The seventh rule, the training rule on building dwellings, is finished.
